name: Amanda Ho
bio:
Brooklyn girl 🗽 in Lisbon 🇵🇹 
🌎 Founder | CEO | Community Builder @regenerativetravel & @weareweeva Ambassador

social_posts.post_text:
Reminiscing, processing and dreaming about the last month of being on the road, from Tanzania, Kenya to Egypt 🇹🇿 🇰🇪 🇪🇬 as a reminder of why I do what I do @regenerativetravel | This #UnderwaterRoom @themantaresort was such a surreal experience and opportunity to be one with the underwater world and it’s wonders 🐟 

#regenerativetravel #zanzibar #tanzania #pembaisland #marineconservation

Despite the hypocritical nature of #COP27 being held in a very unsustainable resort town like Sharm El Sheikh, being sponsored by Coca Cola, and the glacial pace of commitments to decarbonization, we still must have hope in this fight for the climate action and to keep 1.5C alive. #sharmelsheikh #egypt #climateactionnow

Part 1. It’s been one week since I returned from #Egypt following #COP27 and hosting our first @regenerativetravel Regenerative Retreat and I am feeling more inspired than ever before. I am motivated by the collaboration and community around me that is supporting each other. Working in climate can be emotionally challenging with such negative news that we're facing every day such as the imminent collapse of ecosystems, societal pressures and more natural disasters are happening around the world. 

We realized this year after the UN Ocean Conference that It’s important for us to have a safe space for us to come and gather and also be with like-minded individuals that are all working towards the same goals. We launched our retreat with the intention to create a container for people to come together, collaborate, and learn from one another. Travel is such a transformative way for us to actually deepen bonds and connection through shared experiences and seeing new ways of thinking. Regenerative tourism is as much about the regeneration of the communities we travel to but also ourselves. Travel can help us come back to that.

It was a dream to host the retreat at @basata_ecolodge a pioneer eco-lodge in South Sinai, Egypt started almost 4 decades ago. I’m grateful for Sherif, Maria, Sohalia’s incredible hospitality, to @brita_ny for helping program the trip and lead our COP27 discussions alongside co-hosts @dancervenka and @emilie_mcglone and @joanacronica for holding space for our group. Thank you to all who made our retreat so special— @sophfei @iamrobertbain @bonnie.lucille @joanacronica @marcelapulga @becca.reagan @eliseorlowski @tomasdelft @spencerbyamtaylor 

Special thanks to @5media_official 

📸 by @tomasdelft 

#climateleaders #regenerativeretreats

The slow moments in between, soaking in life along the Nile River #deathonthenile 🇪🇬 #egypt #aswan #goldenhour 

 📸: @tomasdelft

Pinch me 🥹 Honored and grateful for our work at @regenerativetravel to be featured in @britishvogue — a huge thanks to @sophfei, fellow Chinese-American sister for her ongoing support of the #regenerativetravel movement and helping us push into the mainstream to reach more conscious travelers 💙 🌎 >>

“How do you travel?” is a complex question to answer today within the current landscape of the climate crisis. Those who are concerned about the environment tread lightly before answering or sharing on social media their great love of wanderlust. This question has even found a name in Swedish, “smygflyga”, which directly translates to “flight shame”.

Yes, travelling sustainably may seem like an oxymoron these days while we await technologies to scale. Yet, there is another side of the climate community that is working to ensure travel experiences and trips can yield a net positive impact. Regenerative Travel co-founder and CEO Amanda Ho launched her company in 2019 in a bid to not just reduce the environmental impact of travel, but also give back to the planet. “Regeneration is a more positive, aspirational way to look at the world and ultimately brings hope into the tourism and travel industry,” she tells Vogue.” — words by @sophfei 

Read the full story by clicking the link in my bio that covers our mission behind @regenerativetravel and how regenerative travel can be a force for good featuring our founding Regenerative Hotel™ in Egypt @basata_ecolodge 

Photos by @tomasdelft 

#regenerativetravel #regenerativetourism #egypt #southsinai #cop27

Part 2. Snapshots continued from our first #RegenerativeRetreat at @basata_ecolodge in Egypt with some of my favorite moments breaking bread with the local #bedoiun women, our round table on COP27 takeaways and hiking into the #Sinai mountains for a dinner by campfire under the stars. 

We can’t wait to share our new destinations for 2023! Sign up to join our waitlist at regenerativetravel.com/retreats

📸 by @tomasdelft 

#regenerativetravel #regenerativetourism #egypt

I get chills every time I watch this film and relive its truth. 

As the 27th annual UN Climate Summit—known as COP27—concluded this past month in Sharm el-Sheikh, Egypt, the next generation of climate leaders gathered alongside to learn about regenerative tourism in Egypt and how to co-create a regenerative future at our first @regenerativetravel  Regenerative Retreat in South Sinai at @basata_ecolodge. Grateful for our host committee @brita_ny @dancervenka @emilie_mcglone 

🎥 Film by the very talented @spencerbyamtaylor who I’ve collaborated with for the past 7 years on nearly every continent 🙌🏼

Join our future retreats - apply at regenerativetravel.com/retreats
 
#cop27 #egypt #retreats #sinai #regenerativetravel

To finding balance in 2023 — exploring the world and slowing down with moments like these on the Nile where time stands still. 🇪🇬 

#Protip: If you are planning a trip to Egypt, I recommend a Dahabiya Nile cruise for a more intimate and authentic experience visiting the local villages and witnessing life along the Nile instead of the larger and more opulent ships. #regenerativetravel #nileriver #nilecruise #egypt

Touchdown on Planet Earth 🚀 🌍 
#abusimbel #aswan #aliensarereal #egypt
Dreamy interior design aesthetics and the most soulful Tanzanian hospitality on safari in the Serengeti at @andbeyondgrumeti #tanzania #andbeyond

Happy in the bush! 🐘 Last year I had the honor of attending the first @andbeyondtravel #WILDeconomy Masterclass in partnership with @alueducation hosted by Dr Sue Snyman (@suesnyman) at @andbeyondgrumeti in the #Serengeti to deep dive into the groundbreaking research on the economic potential of five key focus activities within Africa’s Wildlife Economy. Follow @alueducation for more #tanzania #africa #wildlifeeconomy #regenerativetravel
A little bit of Bali 💙#canggu #bali #indonesia #indome

Nestled in the heart of an ancient rainforest @thedatailangkawi embodies all that we stand for at @regenerativetravel with regeneration at the heart of its #DataiPledge through its operations and support of NGOs working in the region including:

🍃 Environmental conservation: The resort actively protects and rehabilitates the rainforest and coral reefs through initiatives like reforestation and marine conservation programs with @marecet @xploregaia 

👥 Community engagement: The Datai works with local communities to promote sustainable tourism practices and support local businesses, creating a positive impact on the local economy like it’s upcycling projects with @thekanshalifeproject 

🗑️ Waste management: The resort minimizes waste through recycling and composting, and has implemented sustainable practices like using biodegradable materials and reducing single-use plastics.

💡Energy conservation: The resort has implemented energy-efficient practices like using solar energy, LED lighting, and energy-efficient appliances to reduce their carbon footprint.

#regenerativetravel #regenerativetourism

Women.Life.Freedom.
Celebrating women all over the world ✊🏻✊🏼✊🏽✊🏾✊🏿
#happyinternationalwomensday 

📸 by @tomasdelft 🖤
Can’t take the New York out of a New Yorker 🗽#shesback #brooklynforever #williamsburger #dominopark

#NYC incoming!! April is Earth Month 🌍 and I’m excited to share @regenerativetravel is hosting our #EarthDay 2023 event "Reimagining The Future of Regenerative Hospitality" in partnership with @davinesofficial x @comfortzoneskin_us at their HQ North America in Brooklyn, New York on Tuesday, April 18th at 4:00pm ET.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Join us as we debut our inaugural #AgencyofChange trade membership alongside other exciting announcements. We’ll be engaging in insightful panel discussions from travel and hospitality insiders.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Featured Speakers:⁠⠀
- @jenninecohen of @womentravelleaders / @gouncharted 
- Dana Krauskopf of @hamanasi_resort 
- Bárbara Büchel of @viatu_travel ⁠⠀
- @mauricesmith404 of @eugenetorikotravel ⁠⠀
- @iampaulsalmon of @rockhousehotel 
- Vivian Temba of @kantabileafrika ⁠⠀
- @wdnomad of @indexselect 
- Wendy Cole of @hospitalitygrowthsolutions 

Discussion topics will include:⁠⠀
- Regeneration in Wild Places and Remote Communities⁠⠀
- Developing Regenerative Leadership from Within⁠⠀
- The Convergence of Stewardship and Climate Justice⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Enjoy catering by culinary master, Kirsten Dixon from @withinthewild, a Regenerative Hotel™.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Learn more and register by becoming a RegenerativeTravel+ member at the link in my bio!
⁠⠀
#regenerativehospitality #regenerativetourism #regenerativetravel

For #EarthDay2023 we gathered our @regenerativetravel community in Brooklyn, New York at the @davinesnorthamerica to celebrate the launch of our new trade program. 🌎 

We are aware that for the entire travel industry to make the paradigm shift toward regeneration, every member and stakeholder within travel needs to be involved. By working together with travel agents, we hope to highlight the pioneers offering the most sought-after and positively impactful regenerative travel experiences for travelers. Changing the travel industry for the better will require collaboration across all stakeholders, especially as solutions are not always straightforward and require the integration of various perspectives. We are keen to unite Agencies of Change and Regenerative Travel members in exploring and paving the path forward for a regenerative future.

Thanks to all of our speakers @wdnomad @hamanasi_resort @jenninecohen @womentravelleaders @mauricesmith404 @eugenetorikotravel @iampaulsalmon @rockhousehotel @babseando @viatu_travel and catering from @withinthewild 

#regenerativetravel #agencyofchange #regenerativetourism
Behind the scenes of this #EarthWeek the New York way 🌎💚🗽#regenerationisthefuture #earthday

As we bid farewell to #EarthMonth, I am thrilled to share with you the latest coverage featuring the growing #RegenerativeTravel movement! Together, we can pave the way towards a brighter and more sustainable future by shifting towards regenerative models. Whether you're a traveler or a member of the industry, let's make a conscious effort to leave a positive impact on the communities we visit and the planet we call home. 

Links in bio to all of the latest stories!

Thanks to:
@julietkinsman @condenasttraveller @k_rellihan @afarmedia @richroll @adamskolnick @paulhawken @apesroks @ttgmedia 🌎🌿🌍 

#RegenerativeTravel #Sustainability #CommunityImpact #EarthMonth #PositiveChange #Regenerative #Regeneration

location.city_name: MoMA The Museum of Modern Art

social_posts.post_text:
Welcome to the future! 🚀 The #Unsupervised AI art installation at @themuseumofmodernart brought to life by the visionary artist @refikanadol is a mind-bending journey through over 200 years of modern art. Through the power of machine learning, Anadol has reimagined the history of art and created a breathtaking, otherworldly landscape that continuously evolves before your eyes. 

As someone who has been playing around with #AI and #ChatGPT for the past week, I am already blown away by its power and limitless potential in business operations and beyond. It's exciting to think about where we can go from here.

Join me on this journey into the future of art and tech! 🎨🤖 #Unsupervised #AIart #RefikAnadol #MoMA #FutureTech"
Home is where the heart is ❤️I still love you #NewYork. Here’s an ode to all the things that make this city magic (and the greatest city in the world)🥹 #nyc #brooklyn #williamsburg

Are you ready to be a part of the change? Join @regenerativetravel on a journey of regeneration and connection with our upcoming retreats. Our first retreat in #Egypt was an unforgettable experience, and we can’t wait to share our upcoming retreat for 2023. 

Experience the power of community as we bring together changemakers from across climate, impact, hospitality, marketing and communications, finance and NGOs/non-profits. Immerse yourself in the local culture and discover a new destination through the lens of regenerative tourism. 

Learn from experts and like-minded individuals as we dive into practical steps towards climate action through tourism. Let’s create a regenerative future together. Join our waitlist now to be the first to know about our 2023 retreat at the link in my bio! 

Special thanks to @eliseorlowski for capturing these moments on #super8 film 🎞️ 🎥 

#RegenerativeRetreats #TravelwithPurpose #ClimateAction #RegenerativeTourism #RegenerativeTravel

If you know me I am a very proud #Brooklyngirl. As a resident of #Williamsburg for over a decade (since 2013!!) I have witnessed firsthand the transformation of this vibrant neighborhood into a hub for creative industries. One place that has remained a constant pillar of the community is the @wythehotel. 

Having been a long-time loyal patron of the hotel (with @barblondeau being a regular pit stop) I can attest to its commitment to sustainability and community-minded practices. The hotel's industrial roots are seamlessly integrated into its design, with exposed brick walls, cast iron columns, and wooden ceilings, all preserving the building's early 20th-century origins as a textile factory with design by @adjmi 

By preserving history, promoting inclusivity, restoring marine and coastal ecosystems with @billionoyster, reducing waste, and prioritizing health and well-being, Wythe Hotel is contributing to a more sustainable and equitable future for all. I could not be more excited that the #WytheHotel is now part of the @regenerativetravel community. 

Learn more about the Wythe's impact commitments at the link in my bio! 

Lots more announcements to come about our flagship #RegenerativeTravelSummit2023 that will be held at the @wythehotel on September 20th during #ClimateWeek2023! #savethedate 

Follow @wythehotel @regenerativetravel and @brita_ny for exciting #regenerativetravel news coming soon! 

#regenerativetourism #regenerativetravel #sustainabletravel
Dreaming about my Lisbon 🇵🇹 life and second home! Finally got my 🎞️ rolls developed from my housewarming 🫶🏼 can’t wait to be back in the +351! 🔜 #lisboa #portugal

Slower, island days on film in #Ubud, #Bali earlier this year 💚 thanks to @greenbyjohn for hosting at @bambuindah a little slice of paradise that embodies all regenerative principles from its bamboo design ad its farm to table menu to its ethos in preserving the natural world and communities that surround the hotel. #bali

I live for the ocean 🌊 which is one of the reasons I’m most excited to move (part time) to #Lisbon to live a life more connected to nature and to be by the sea. 

As we celebrate @unworldoceansday today in the midst of the worst air pollution #NYC has ever seen, we recognize the importance of how the oceans sustain all life on earth. 

Congrats to @oceanic.global @leadauriol @nattyiceberg for an inspiring event reminding us how we need to put our oceans first! #unworldoceansday #saveouroceans 💙
The beginning of a very Lisboan summer 🇵🇹 ☀️😎 #lisboa #portugal #hereforit
In my princess era 👑 #amieuropeanyet #portugal 💓

SAVE THE DATE: As @regenerativetravel lands in #Lisbon, we’re excited to host our first #RegenerativeHospitality Mixer on Wednesday, July 26 in Lisbon at @weareninho from 7:00 - 9:00 pm.

Join us to connect with other values-aligned hoteliers and industry professionals leading in sustainable and regenerative practices throughout the country and in Europe. We will share an overview of what regenerative tourism means, and practical steps for operators to integrate principles into practice.

We look forward to sharing the programming and spotlighting the opportunity for regenerative hospitality in Portugal as we hear from leading operators and destination management companies. 

Whether you are a traveler, hoteliers, travel agent, agency or DMC we invite you to come and meet other like-minded change makers who are interested to further regenerative tourism. Come join us if you happen to be in town! 

A very special thanks to @kukureko for the opportunity to host at this beautiful space. 🙏🏼

Register at the link in my bio! #regenerativetravel #regenerativetourisn #regenerativehospitality

After months in the making I am excited to share my latest venture @makasihlife. 

We were born on a trip to #Bali, when a #NewYork city girl landed on the Island of Gods. As a global nomad, I have long treasured the designs and craftsmanship of artisans around the world that I have discovered along my travels. 

We are committed to bringing you timeless pieces that will become a staple in your wardrobe at home and on your travels, made by trusted makers

Discover our first collection inspired by where the sun meets the earth and where the sea meets the sand.

Thank you to those who helped bring this vision to life, namely my partner in crime @tomasdelft and @mariaokaykay 

🖤
Thanks it’s @makasihlife ❤️‍🔥#makasihlife #lisboa

Thank you to all who came to join us for @regenerativetravel’s first event in Lisbon (and in Europe)!! It’s been a continuing journey in making my move to Portugal 🇵🇹 and I’m grateful for all of the support in gathering and building an inspiring community of like-minded souls working to create a regenerative future in travel and in our world. A big OBGRIDADA to everyone who came, to our speakers @carolina_macanita from @visitazores and Alex Camacho from isla and @agreenerfuture for their inspiring insights! A big thank you to @kukureko and @weareninho for having us in such a beautiful space. #lisbon #portugal #travelindustry #regenerativetravel #sustainabletravel

We urgently face the climate crisis as heat waves and extreme heat soar across the world 🔥 What is the answer? We need to regenerate our planet — @regenerativetravel explored at our latest event in Lisbon @weareninho how the travel and hospitality can be a force for healing and how policy/governments need to lead to way to establish frameworks that can lead to systematic change across the sector. @carolina_macanita from @visitazores shared a leading case study and how community engagement is essential for successful implementation. We discussed the importance of data, monitoring and benchmarking in destination management and for events/festival organizers with Alex Camacho from @agreenerfuture. Keep an eye out for our next event in Lisboa and join us in New York for our annual Summit! 🗽

Photos by @filipaaurelio #regenerativetravel #lisbon #ninho #climatechange #regeneration
Holding on to these last summer days filled with sunsets, ocean, seafood and good beats #obgrigadalisbon 🇵🇹🦞💦

Who’s coming on safari with me in December x @regenerativetravel?! We just have TWO spots left — apply before we sell out!! 🦁 🐘 I’ve been dreaming of going to Botswana for years and it’s a dream come true to co-host this trip with @beksndlovu and @suesnyman as we co-create the blue print for regenerative tourism together on this trip through collaborative workshops and discussion. DM me for more information on our #RegenerativeRetreat! #regenerativetravel

I am supposed to be en route to #Marrakech right at this very moment, but last night on Friday, September 8, a 6.8 magnitude #earthquake struck the #HighAtlas region where our @regenerativetravel partner @kasbahdutoubkal hotel’s long standing charity partner @efa_morocco Education For All's boarding houses are situated (in the area where my photos are here from my trip this past March), resulting in significant damage to all of the organization's houses. Efforts are currently underway to obtain updates from the girls who had returned to their villages. In addition to the immediate need for house repairs, Education For All envisions providing both emergency and long-term support for the affected girls and their families.

The earthquake has left the High Atlas region of Morocco in distress. Education For All operates boarding houses in this area, serving as a vital resource for teenage girls residing in remote regions to access local schools and receive necessary support. Regrettably, all of Education For All's boarding houses have sustained severe damage due to the earthquake, necessitating immediate repair work and the replacement of damaged furniture and computers.

The proposed solution involves raising funds to address the pressing needs of emergency repairs for the six damaged houses and the replacement of their contents. Additionally, the project aims to provide essential emergency support, encompassing food, medicine, water, and communication assistance, to benefit the affected girls, their families, and the local communities. All donations received will be allocated to both short-term and long-term initiatives, focused on the reconstruction of the houses and the communities where the girls originate.

In terms of long-term impact, Education For All aims to restore the boarding houses, thereby enabling the continued fulfillment of its mission to facilitate access to education for teenage girls.

Our thoughts and prayers go out to all of our partners who are were affected. We stand with all of our community who are in the country and or en route and stand by for further updates 🙏🏼🇲🇦 Follow the link in my bio to donate.

I’m thrilled to share that our annual Regenerative Travel Summit (@regenerativetravel) is set to take place during #ClimateWeekNYC 2023. After our 2 editions held virtually during COVID I could have only dreamt of this taking place in-person in my hometown, Brooklyn, New York. 

As we unite to create a more sustainable and regenerative future for travel, we invite you to join us on September 20, 2023, at the prestigious @wythehotel in Brooklyn, New York. 
 Date: September 20, 2023
Time: 1:00-8:00 PM
Location: Wythe Hotel, New York, NY

The Regenerative Travel Summit brings together trailblazers, visionaries, and experts from around the world to explore innovative solutions for a more sustainable and positive future of travel. This year's summit is built around key themes, each designed to inspire actionable change within the industry.

Our Summit is more than just an event; it is a platform to propel the industry toward a regenerative future. Together, we will explore innovative ideas, share best practices, and inspire one another to build an industry that creates a positive environmental and social impact. By joining us, you will have the opportunity to connect with like-minded professionals, forge partnerships, and contribute to shaping the future of travel. 

Meet our featured speakers:
Alexia Akbay - @lexakbay / @symbrosia.co
Alejandra Liévano - @casamucura

En route back to Brooklyn ✈️ ✈️ Coming to #NYC for Climate Week? 🗽 I’ve put together a travel guide of my favorite #regenerative approved places to stay, eat, drink, and shop around #Williamsburg, #Brooklyn! Peek the edit on @luxecityguides — the full version will land in the inbox of everyone joining for the @regenerativetravel summit!

#brooklynforever #williamsburg

Portugal summer wrap up 🇵🇹 
Até logo 👋🏼 #Obrigada
New York, New York! 🗽You give me life. I’m energized to be home in this crazy city as we gear up for a busy week ahead #ClimateWeekNYC 💪🏼 Who’s coming to our @regenerativetravel Summit?! 😎

Still processing (and recovering!!) from all of the incredible connections and collaborations as a result of #ClimateWeekNYC. With the convergence of #UNGA that happens alongside, we embarked on a journey to explore how the tourism industry can serve as a catalyst for positive change at our @regenerativetravel Summit held as part of #ClimateWeekNYC at @wythehotel last week. I am blown away by the individuals and companies who joined us in the spirit of coming together to find solutions and pathways to work towards our unified vision of a regenerative future. 

Our discussions revolved around its potential to empower communities, inspire innovative policy and governance, drive climate-friendly advancements, and harness regenerative agriculture to aid in our planet's healing while reducing its carbon footprint.⁠
⁠
The solution to this profound challenge lies in unity and collaboration. It is imperative that we join forces, acknowledging our shared responsibility to be active participants in this regenerative movement 🌎🌎🌎

A big thank you to all of our speakers and partners:

Alexia Akbay - @lexakbay / @symbrosia.co

Behind the scenes of another inspiring #ClimateWeekNYC 🌎🗽

- Speaking on the @andbeyondtravel event with Beyond Green (@staybeyondgreen), Bhutan Tourism (@tourismbhutan), The Bhutan Foundation (@bhutanfdn), Regenerative Travel (@regenerativetravel) and Virtuoso (@virtuosoltd) featuring Jessica Nabongo (@jessicanabongo), Tshewang Wangchuk, Javier Arredondo (@javier_arredondo_), Costas Christ and myself discussing how we can empower travelers to be change makers.

- Hanging with some of best in the travel industry who champion the future of @regenerativetravel after our Summit!

- Filming the last segments of our educational course with host @oshannonburns — coming soon! 🎥

#andBeyondTravel #StayBeyondGreen #Bhutanfoundation #Bhutanbelieve #BhutanTourism #RegenerativeTravel #VirtuosoTravel #FromTravelerToChangeMaker
#NewYork #Sustainabletravel

Yamon 🇯🇲🇯🇲🇯🇲 Every little thing is gonna be alright 

The spirit of Bob Marley lives on Jamaica and it’s easy to see why! Thanks to the entire @rockhousehotel team and @iampaulsalmon for making my little birthday getaway so memorable. I’ve been wanting to visit Rockhouse in #Negril as a @regenerativetravel member for a long time and it was a dream. Reasons to put this property on your list:

- Direct airlift from NYC, just 4 hours to Montego Bay
- Most incredible and friendly staff, shout to Bally the grounds manger who gave us a full back of house tour to see where they make all of the furniture for the hotel onsite, in addition to candles 🕯️ and soap 🧼
- Rockhouse supports the Rockhouse Foundation where they build primary schools in Jamaica for special needs children and provide education for over 200+ students 
-  Psilocybin 🍄 sound bath on Sundays with an incredible practitioner and facilitator @jasonleeworton 
- Access to @skylarknegril, the sister property on Seven Mile beach
- Jerk chicken at the original @misslilys and @skylarknegril 🍗 
- RELAXING and DISCONNECTING in the most beautiful setting around Rockhouse, bathing in warm Caribbean waters and cliff jumping 

Need I say more?! 

#onelove #yamon #jamaica #negril
Jamminn’ in #Jamaica 🇯🇲🖤💚💛 at @rockhousehotel #onelove #bobmarley #negril #regenerativetravel

It’s been a whirlwind of a month since our @regenerativetravel Summit! NYC is truly the city that never sleeps 🗽

Special thanks to @tsangdow for capturing our Summit so beautifully 🎥 we’re already hard at work to announce our 2024 dates!

Thanks to @essentialist for having me in San Francisco to talk about the Future of Travel with @benpundole 

Always a pleasure to catch @beksndlovu when in town @wdnomad @k_rellihan 

One more week til Lisboa 😎🇵🇹

After two years in the making, I am proud to announce my official ambassadorship with @weareweeva, in collaboration with @regenerativetravel.

This strategic partnership focuses on improving the tracking and communication of sustainability efforts for our affiliated hotels. With sustainability and regeneration becoming key priorities in the travel sector, Regenerative Travel’s focus is to enable our hotels to showcase their commitment to sustainable and regenerative practices using robust data.

Weeva is a revolutionary digital platform for the tourism sector that enables the holistic management of sustainability data. I have been fortunate enough to travel the world and go behind the scenes on what are called “back of house tours” to see all of the “non-sexy” work that guests often don’t see on their luxury vacation. This has allowed me to witness incredible innovation at many hotels that are pioneers such as recycling and waste management, regenerative agriculture and hydroponic farming, community engagement, and empowerment leading the way in environmental stewardship and social responsibility. 

Spotlighted here we have:
- @rockhousehotel in Jamaica featuring its hydroponic greenhouse, water bottle recycling ♻️ 
- @thedatailangkawi and their back-of-house waste sort center and Pure of for the Future initiative for educating guests on sustainability 🗑️ 
- @potatoheadbali in Bali with their reuse of plastic in the creation of its furniture and materials around the hotel 🪑 

We are excited to keep you updated on the progress and news emerging from our collaboration in the upcoming weeks! So proud to be part of the Weeva family with @jules.cheetham @eatingthroughmyworld @julietkinsman 

#regenerativetravel #regenerativetourism #datacollection #sustainability #sustainabletravel #weeva

location.city_name: MAAT - Museu de Arte, Arquitetura e Tecnologia

social_posts.post_text: Home ❤️🇵🇹 #lisboa #portugal

It’s been a big year of growth and building community behind the @regenerativetravel movement. I’m grateful for all of the journalists, publications, hoteliers, agents, and individuals who have believed in our mission. I’m proud to represent the work of so many entrepreneurs around the world who have committed their lives to protecting our planet and to have this recognized by the media! 💚💚💚 I’m hopeful that with this type of nod from @delta and @travelandleisure that the industry is ready to undergo a shift towards regenerative models in a real way in 2024 with more ambitious goals and commitments towards net-zero. 

Thank you @travelandleisure @elledecor @ttgmedia @apesroks @theforwardlab @jacquigiff @lefigaro @marinesanclemente @richroll @adamskolnick @julietkinsman @evening.standard 

#regenerativetravel #regenerativetourism

Scariest thing that you did in 2023?! Mine was getting on this scenic flight in Botswana to see the Okavango Delta from above. Not going to lie I was extremely nervous, but thanks to our pilot Jack at @helicopterhorizons for making us feel safe👌🏼 🚁 #botswana #okavango #heli

There was no better way to end 2023 than with our @regenerativetravel #Botswana retreat x @africanbushcamps! Grateful for my co-hosts the brilliant @suesnyman from @aluconservation and the inspiring founder of @africanbushcamps @beksndlovu and our curious and diverse group. It’s taken some weeks to process all that we shared, experienced and learned from one another in the best classroom there is — the Khwai Reserve in the #OkavangoDelta. Travel is truly a bonding experience like no other. #pulafamily

Who’s coming with us this year on our next retreat? 

#regenerativetravel #botswana #safari #africa
Part II from #Botswana with @regenerativetravel x @africanbushcamps .. missing this epic group and being in the bush! 🦁 🐘 🦓 #regenerativetravel #safari

I can’t wait to be back in #CapeTown already and go deeper into the fabric of its complex and layered history and all it’s nature has to offer 😍😍 Staying in Hout Bay @futurefoundsanctuary of @regenerativetravel gave me a whole new perspective of the #MotherCity. See you in May 🫶🏼 🇿🇦 #southafrica #capetown #africa

I am honored to have been invited to speak next week at @fiturmadrid on Advancing Climate Action for @unwto Glasgow Declaration | Roundtable 2 on Private sector-led climate action where I will be representing @regenerativetravel and @weareweeva . 

Join us at #FITUR2024 for a dynamic discussion with the signatories of the Glasgow Declaration on Climate Action in Tourism. This event, featuring two roundtables, will showcase progress since the Declaration’s inception at COP26 and brainstorm on next steps.

Discussants:
- Tim Fairhurst, Director General, Director of Policy, European Tourism Association (ETOA)
- Sven Wiltink, Global Senior Director Sustainability, Radisson Hotel Group
- Andrea Fuentes, Senior Contracting Executive, Intrepid Travel, West Europe
- Luz Tribaldos, Sustainability and Social Responsibility Expert, Europa Mundo Vacaciones S.L.U.
- Amanda Ho, Co-Founder & CEO, Regenerative Travel
- Mirabilia Network of Chambers of Commerce (tbc)

As of December 2023, over 850 organizations have signed the Glasgow Declaration. The goal is to foster collaboration, share innovative practices, and reinforce our collective commitment to driving climate action the tourism sector. 

As sustainability and regeneration emerge as critical elements in the travel industry, Regenerative Travel aims to empower hotels to demonstrate their dedication to these practices through the use of comprehensive data. Our collaborative effort is centered on enhancing the monitoring and reporting of sustainability initiatives at our partner hotels through our partnership with @weareweeva.

If you’re at @fiturmadrid next week please drop me a line! 🇪🇸 🌎 ✈️ ♻️ More info on the session at the link in my bio! 

#regenerativetravel #regenerativetourism #fitur2024

Brooklyn girl 🗽 in Lisbon 🇵🇹
